name: Getaway Car
instructions:
1. Fill a shaker tin half-full with pebble ice.
2. Add all ingredients and shake.
3. Fill a Zombie mug half-full with pebble ice.
4. Strain into the mug, and garnish with a lime wheel and a sprinkle of ancho powder.
description: Meaghan Dorman's take on the Jungle Bird cocktail recipe swaps in Ancho Reyes for Campariâ€”alongside a kick of ancho chili powder.
garnish: lime wheel and a sprinkle of ancho powder

ingredients.name: Dark Rum
ingredients.description: Dark rum is a type of rum that is aged longer and often in charred barrels, giving it a darker color and a richer, more robust flavor compared to lighter rums. It typically has notes of caramel, molasses, and sometimes spices. Dark rum is commonly used in cocktails, especially those with a strong, flavorful profile, and it is also enjoyed neat or on the rocks. The aging process contributes to the development of complex flavors and a smoother texture.

ingredients.name: Pineapple juice
ingredients.description: Pineapple juice is extracted by passing fresh, ripe pineapple through a juice extractor (juicer) or by muddling fresh cut pineapple chunks and then straining out the solids.

ingredients.name: Ancho Reyes
ingredients.description:
Ancho Reyes is a brand of chile liqueur produced in Puebla City, Mexico, based on a 1927 recipe from the same city. The liqueur is made from and named after Puebla's renowned ancho chiles, a dried form of ripe poblano peppers.

The company produces two types of chile liqueur: the original, red Ancho Reyes liqueur and the newer, green Ancho Reyes Verde liqueur. The liqueur is produced using late harvest chiles that have sun-dried for 2 to 3 weeks. For the Verde version of the drink, early harvested fire-roasted poblano chiles are used in addition to the sun-dried chiles.

Both the red and green liqueurs are 40% ABV and are popular for adding a bit of spice to classic drinks like a margarita or a Paloma.

ingredients.name: Simple Syrup
ingredients.description: Syrup made with sugar and water. Usually in 1:1 or 2:1 ratio.
